prompts.nameTaken: Please select a name you haven't used
prompts.markPreviousRead: The reading you requested was marked complete. Would you like to mark all readings previous to it complete as well?
prompts.scheduleRecreatedMessage: Your schedule was recreated. Please compare the new schedule with the original schedule (Old) to make sure no information was lost and then delete the old schedule.

readingRemindersPopup.body0-1: Find a location that is quiet and free from distractions
readingRemindersPopup.body0-2: (Perhaps put your phone into silent mode)
readingRemindersPopup.body1-1: Ask Jehovah to put you in the proper frame of mind and to give you his Holy Spirit to help you understand and apply what you read.
readingRemindersPopup.body2-2: What does this tell me about Jehovah God?
readingRemindersPopup.body2-3: How does this section of the Scriptures contribute to the Bible's message?
readingRemindersPopup.body2-4: How can I apply this in my life?
readingRemindersPopup.body2-5: How can I use these verses to help others?
readingRemindersPopup.body2-6: What would you see, hear, and smell?
readingRemindersPopup.body2-7: What may be the feelings of those involved?
readingRemindersPopup.body3-1: If we see the practical value of an activity, we benefit more from it.
readingRemindersPopup.body3-2: We need to take action to apply what we learned in our life and understand how we can use what we learned to help others.
readingRemindersPopup.body3-3: Please go to those links to get a deeper understanding of the thoughts expressed

scheduleTypePopup.sequentialDescription: Read the bible from Genesis to Revelation
scheduleTypePopup.chronologicalDescription: Read the bible in the order in which events occurred. (EXPERIMENTAL: If you find a discrepency please contact me)
scheduleTypePopup.thematicDescription: Each day, read from a different section of the Bible in a weekly cycle: Day 1 - The Law, 2 - History, 3 - Psalms, 4 - Poetry, 5 - Prophecy, 6 - Gospels, 7 - Letters
scheduleTypePopup.customDescription: Create a custom schedule for a publication

long.title: Long
long.description: Starts on Nisan 8 and ends on Nisan 16 and includes more verses to read each day. Based on the schedule found in Apendix B12 of the New World Translation

short.title: Short
short.description: Starts on Nisan 9 and ends on Nisan 16 and includes less verses to read each day. Based on the schedule found in the Examining the Scriptures Daily booklet
